metadata.title: CVE-2023-1192 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in smb2_is_status_io_timeout() in CIFS inthe Linux Kernel. After CIFS transfers response data to a system call,there are still local variable points to the memory region, and if thesystem call frees it faster than CIFS uses it, CIFS will access a freememory region, leading to a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-34-generic - 6.2.0-34.34
linux-image-6.2.0-34-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-34.34
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-34-generic - 6.2.0-34.34
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-34-generic-64k - 6.2.0-34.34
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-34.34').
linux-kvm package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needed').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-oracle package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-raspi package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needed').
linux-starfive package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
